text: Madison Square Garden in New York City, New York The 2005 Country Music Association Award, 39th Annual Ceremony, took place on November 15, 2005 and was the first ceremony to be held at the Madison Square Garden in New York City, New York, hosted by Brooks & Dunn. == Winners and Nominees == Bold denotes the winners {| class="wikitable" ! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Entertainer of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Album of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Keith Urban ** Kenny Chesney ** Alan Jackson ** Toby Keith ** Brad Paisley | valign="top" | * There's More Where That Came From — Lee Ann Womack **Be Here — Keith Urban ** Feels Like Today — Rascal Flatts ** Live Like You Were Dying — Tim McGraw ** Somewhere Down In Texas — George Strait'' |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Male Vocalist of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Female Vocalist of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Keith Urban ** Kenny Chesney ** Alan Jackson ** Brad Paisley ** George Strait | valign="top" | * Gretchen Wilson ** Sara Evans ** Alison Krauss ** Martina McBride ** Lee Ann Womack |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Group of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Duo of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Rascal Flatts ** Alison Krauss + Union Station (feat. Jerry Douglas) ** Diamond Rio ** Lonestar ** Sugarland | valign="top" | * Brooks & Dunn ** Big & Rich ** Montgomery Gentry ** Van Zant ** The Warren Brothers |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Single of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Song of the Year |- | valign="top" | * "I May Hate Myself In The Morning" — Lee Ann Womack **"Alcohol" — Brad Paisley ** "As Good As I Once Was" — Toby Keith ** "Baby Girl" — Sugarland ** "Bless the Broken Road" — Rascal Flatts | valign="top" | * "Whiskey Lullaby" — Bill Anderson, Jon Randall ** "Alcohol" — Brad Paisley ** "As Good As I Once Was" — Toby Keith, Scotty Emerick ** "Bless The Broken Road" — Marcus Hummon, Bobby Boyd, Jeff Hanna ** "I May Hate Myself In The Morning" — Odie Blackmon ** "Redneck Woman" — Gretchen Wilson, John Rich |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Horizon Award ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Musician of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Dierks Bentley ** Big & Rich ** Miranda Lambert ** Julie Roberts ** Sugarland | valign="top" | * Jerry Douglas, Dobro **Paul Franklin, Steel guitar ** Dann Huff, Electric guitar ** Brent Mason, Guitar/Electric Guitar ** Randy Scruggs, Guitar/Mandolin |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Music Video of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Musical Event of the Year |- | valign="top" | * "As Good As I Once Was" — Toby Keith ** "Alcohol" — Brad Paisley ** "Days Go By" — Keith Urban ** "I May Hate Myself In The Morning" — Lee Ann Womack ** "When I Think About Cheatin'" — Gretchen Wilson | valign="top" | * "Good News, Bad News" — George Strait with Lee Ann Womack ** "I'll Never Be Free" — Willie Nelson with Lee Ann Womack ** "New Again" — Brad Paisley with Sara Evans ** "Party For Two" — Shania Twain ** "Trip Around The Sun" — Jimmy Buffett with Martina McBride |} == References == Category:Country music awards Country Music Association Category:American country music CMA Country Music Association Awards Category:Country Music Association Awards Category:November 2005 events in the United States
title: 2005 Country Music Association Awards
